item.title: S. 1888, Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017
item.description: As ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs on October 4, 2017

summary.text:
Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017

This bill increases the Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment (VSIP) to not exceed $40,000 (currently, $25,000), with an annual adjustment for inflation.

bill.title: Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017'

item.title: Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017'
Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017

item.titleType: Short Titles as Reported to Senate
item.title: Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment Adjustment Act of 2017'

A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to increase the maximum amount of a Voluntary Separation Incentive Payment and to include an annual adjustment in accordance with the Consumer Price Index.

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 562.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
